parts.question_text: Express \( (5 - \sqrt{7})^2 \) in the form \( p + q\sqrt{7} \), where \(p\) and \(q\) are integers to be found.
parts.solution_text:
To expand \( (5 - \sqrt{7})^2 \), we can use the formula \( (a - b)^2 = a^2 - 2ab + b^2 \). In this case, \( a = 5 \) and \( b = \sqrt{7} \). 

So, \( (5 - \sqrt{7})^2 = 5^2 - 2(5)(\sqrt{7}) + (\sqrt{7})^2 \)

\( = 25 - 10\sqrt{7} + 7 \)

\( = 32 - 10\sqrt{7} \)

Therefore, \( p = 32 \) and \( q = -10 \).
